events.name: Blockchain Programming for Programmers - Session 6
events.description: Please register here, https://www.sginnovate.com/events/blockchain-programming-programmers-session-6 Blockchain Programming for Programmers - Session 6 Organised by Propine Capital. Partnered With SGInnovate This is a hands-on event - please come with laptops. We will be programming. At the end of the session, you should have working code. At the session on 11 June, we will be going through more functions of ERC20, and building your own functions based on ERC20. Date: 11 June 2018Time: 5:00pm – 7:00pmVenue: BASH, #03-01, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Singapore 139955 Speaker: Liang Zan Wong, CTO, Propine Capital Over 12 years of experience as a full stack developer on enterprise productsCTO, UrbanFox (Acquired by Keppel T&T)Lead engineer, Dropsuite (Had a successful exit through IPO)Alma mater - NUS (engineering) Note:Basic understanding of cryptocurrencies and Javascript is expected
events.location: BASH, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Level 3, Singapore

events.name: Hashicorp co-founder, Armon Dadgar: Infrastructure as Code with Terraform
events.description: In this talk, we provide an introduction to Infrastructure as Code and HashiCorp Terraform. The core idea of Infrastructure as Code is to manage all aspects of infrastructure in a codified way, via configuration or code, and to apply best practices of software development such as version control. This configuration can then be read by tools like Terraform to automate the provisioning and automation of infrastructure. We will talk about how Terraform works, how to plan changes to infrastructure, and how to automate provisioning. This can be done across low level Infrastructure-as-a-Service, Platform-as-a-Service, or Software-as-a-Service, all with a common workflow. For existing users of Terraform, we will talk about new features in the recent 0.11 and 0.10 releases. A bit about Armon: Co-Founder & Co-CTO @ HashiCorp Armon (@armon) has a passion for distributed systems and their application to real-world problems. He is currently the CTO of HashiCorp, where he brings distributed systems into the world of DevOps tooling. He has worked on Nomad, Vault, Terraform, Consul, and Serf at HashiCorp, and maintains the Statsite and Bloomd OSS projects as well.

events.name: DevOps Meetup - June 2018
events.description: Microsoft office requires id identification 7.00pm - 7.20pm Arrival & Welcome (Pizzas and Drinks served)7.20pm - 8.10pm HashiCorp Vault and Consul Roadmap, Armon Dadgar8.10pm - 8.40pm Q&A with Armon Dadgar HashiCorp Vault and Consul Roadmap, Armon Dadgar---------------------------------------------------------Armon will take us through what HashiCorp Vault and Consul is all about and share with you roadmap details for Vault and Consul. About Armon DadgarArmon Dagar co-founded Hashicorp He is currently the CTO of HashiCorp, where he brings distributed systems into the world of DevOps tooling. He has a passion for distributed systems and their application to real-world problems. events.name: Gophers Pizza Party
events.description: Join us for a casual meetup to meet and chat with our fellow Gophers. 7.30pm — late: Food and mingling There'll be plenty of (free!) pizza and other finger food thanks to GopherCon Singapore, so come hungry. Happy hour is until 8pm.
